> We find that in our sample more than 75% of Byzantine actions have dodged penalty (slashing), highlighting that slashing may not be as effective as widely believed.
If so, how is this happening?  I thought only a single honest validator is required to enforce slashing?

content:
We have been discussing this internally between client teams and it appears they were basing the slashings on incorrect data. <@!361447803194441738> has a short doc in which he tries to recreate slashings for a few of these affected validators :

author: ajsutton
content: Short version - all the data is based off of beaconcha.in rather than the chain itself and beaconcha.in has a couple of indexing bugs. None of the missed slashing are valid.
